references.paper_title: Abandoning objectives: Evolution through the search for novelty alone
references.reason: This paper introduces the Quality-Diversity (QD) search algorithm, which forms the basis for the Rainbow Teaming methodology.

references.paper_title: Illuminating search spaces by mapping elites
references.reason: This paper introduces the MAP-Elites algorithm, which is directly leveraged by Rainbow Teaming for quality-diversity optimization.

references.paper_title: Red teaming language models with language models
references.reason: This paper is the most similar in approach to Rainbow Teaming, using LLMs to generate adversarial prompts, although lacking the diversity aspect of Rainbow Teaming.

references.paper_title: Jailbreaking black box large language models in twenty queries
references.reason: This paper proposes a black-box method for identifying adversarial prompts but is limited by human-in-the-loop constraints, which Rainbow Teaming addresses.

references.paper_title: Red teaming language models to reduce harms: Methods, scaling behaviors, and lessons learned
references.reason: This paper discusses the importance of red-teaming for improving LLM safety, which is directly addressed and improved by Rainbow Teaming.
